title: Establishes a task force to assess the public health impact of firearm violence and provides for the repeal thereof
summary: Establishes a task force to assess data and information compiled by law enforcement personnel and health providers related to incidents of firearm violence and injury; provides that the task force would designate a state agency to coordinate a statewide system for reporting the nature, incidence and specific causes of firearm violence.

       AN  ACT  to establish a task force to assess the public health impact of
         firearm violence and injury and  providing  for  the  repeal  of  such
         provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative findings and intent. The legislature finds  and
    2  declares   that  firearm  injuries  and  deaths  have  reached  epidemic
    3  proportions, with firearm injuries ranked among the top  ten  causes  of
    4  death among all Americans, and as the leading cause of death among young
    5  African-American  males. The legislature further finds and declares that
    6  this  epidemic  necessitates  public  policies  which  address   firearm
    7  violence  and  injury  as  a  public  health issue and that one critical
    8  component of such policies is an integrated and comprehensive  statewide
    9  effort  to  accurately  document  the  origins,  incidence and nature of
   10  firearm violence and injury in New York state.
   11    The legislature also finds that dispersed and widely varied  data  and
   12  information  related  to  incidents  of  firearm  violence are presently
   13  collected by state and local law enforcement agencies; and that informa-
   14  tion and data related to the nature,  severity  and  causes  of  firearm
   15  injuries are also regularly compiled by health care providers engaged in
   16  the  treatment of such injuries. The legislature finds and declares that
   17  a coordinated and fully integrated statewide network of data and  infor-

    1  mation  is  required to fully assess the public health impact of firearm
    2  violence and injury in New York  state  and  to  formulate  policies  to
    3  combat such violence and injury in the protection of public health.
    4    The  legislature hereby establishes a task force to devise a statewide
    5  network of data and information related to firearm  violence  and  inju-
    6  ries. The task force will coordinate the integration of data compiled by
    7  law  enforcement  agencies and health care providers, related to firearm
    8  violence and injury. This task force will be  comprised  of  appropriate
    9  state agency personnel, law enforcement authorities, health care provid-
   10  ers,  and experts in the fields of epidemiology and ballistics. The task
   11  force will assess the nature and current methods by which  data  related
   12  to firearm violence and injury are compiled and reported by law enforce-
   13  ment  agencies and health care providers. The task force shall recommend
   14  any changes in the nature or manner in which such data is  compiled  and
   15  reported,  to facilitate an on-going, statewide assessment of the public
   16  health impact of firearm violence and injury in New York state.
   17    S 2. An eight member  task  force  is  hereby  established  to  assess
   18  current  data  and information compiled by law enforcement personnel and
   19  health providers related to incidents of firearm  violence  and  injury,
   20  and  to  recommend  mechanisms  by  which  an integrated, statewide data
   21  collection and tracking system may be established to assess  the  public
   22  health impact of such violence and injury.
   23    S  3.  The  task  force shall be comprised of the commissioners of the
   24  department of health and the division of criminal justice services,  who
   25  may designate representatives to act on their behalf.
   26    The  commissioner of the department of health or the designee thereof,
   27  shall chair the task force. The governor shall appoint  two  members  to
   28  the task force: one member shall be an epidemiologist experienced in the
   29  study  of  firearm injuries and one member shall be an expert in firearm
   30  ballistics. The temporary president of the senate and the speaker of the
   31  assembly shall each appoint one member to the task force who shall be  a
   32  member  of a state or local law enforcement agency. The minority leaders
   33  of the senate and assembly shall each appoint one  member  to  the  task
   34  force,  who  shall  be  a  health care provider regularly engaged in the
   35  treatment of firearm injuries. Administrative duties of the  task  force
   36  shall be the responsibility of the department of health.
   37    S  4.  The  task  force shall provide a report to the governor and the
   38  legislature on or before January 15, 2013. Such report shall include:
   39    (a) an identification of the data and informational  needs  associated
   40  with  an assessment of firearm violence and injury as an issue of public
   41  health in New York state;
   42    (b) an identification of any differences among  state  and  local  law
   43  enforcement  agencies in the collection and reporting of information and
   44  data related to firearm violence and injury,  the  basis  for  any  such
   45  differences, and how such differences may be addressed;
   46    (c)  an  identification of any differences among health care providers
   47  and in particular, emergency medical services providers, with regard  to
   48  the collection and reporting of firearm injury data and information, the
   49  basis for such differences, and how such differences may be addressed;
   50    (d)  an  assessment  of the need for improved epidemiological data and
   51  information concerning firearm injuries, including  information  on  the
   52  frequency  and  distribution  of such injuries and the specific types of
   53  firearms associated with various injuries;
   54    (e) an identification of any opportunities for, or barriers to, a more
   55  uniform statewide approach to the collection and reporting of  data  and
   56  information  from  both law enforcement agencies and health care provid-

    1  ers, concerning incidents of firearm violence and injury, with full  and
    2  proper  regard  to  the  protection  of  the  rights  of victims of such
    3  violence and injury and the rights of criminal defendants;
    4    (f)  a  recommendation  of a state agency to assume responsibility for
    5  the planning and  coordination  of  a  statewide  data  and  information
    6  network  comprised  of firearm violence and injury data as reported from
    7  state and local law enforcement agencies and health care providers,  and
    8  designed  to  be  used  in formulating public health strategies to deter
    9  firearm violence and injuries; and
   10    (g) an identification of public health policies and  strategies  which
   11  may  arise  from  a  statewide  data  and information network on firearm
   12  violence and injuries, and focused on the prevention  of  such  violence
   13  and injuries.
   14    The  task  force  shall meet as frequently as its business may require
   15  and members of the task force shall receive no  compensation  for  their
   16  services,  but  shall  be  allowed  their  actual and necessary expenses
   17  incurred in performance of their duties.
   18    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately and shall expire on Febru-
   19  ary 1, 2013 when it shall be deemed repealed.
